thesis.question: How can thermal-aware control policies improve long-term stability and energy efficiency in legged robots?
thesis.claim: By incorporating motor heat state estimation and thermal rewards into reinforcement learning, robots can proactively manage thermal constraints while maintaining task performance.
evidence: Heat2Torque simulation reduces sim-to-real gap by modeling torque degradation
Thermal-aware reward functions enable proactive heat management
Online thermal model adaptation improves estimation accuracy
DRL controllers can balance performance and hardware durability

sub_claims.claim: Motor thermal dynamics can be accurately modeled and simulated
Thermal-aware policies outperform baseline in long-term operation
Online adaptation improves thermal estimation accuracy

reverse_outline.title: Thermal-Aware Control for Long-Term Stability in Legged Robots

thesis_clarity.feedback: Main thesis is clearly stated with supporting sub-claims
thesis_clarity.improvement: Consider emphasizing the novelty aspect more prominently
examples: Highlight the gap in current thermal management approaches
Explicitly state the novel contribution in the first paragraph

evidence_integration.feedback: Evidence is presented but integration could be tighter
evidence_integration.improvement: Link experimental results directly to specific claims
examples: Add direct references from results to sub-claims

logical_flow.improvement: Add more explicit signposting between sections
examples: Use transitional phrases to connect methodology to results
Add section previews at the start of each major section

technical_precision.improvement: Define key terms on first use
examples: Clarify the difference between core and winding temperature

reproducibility.improvement: Include hyperparameter tables and hardware specifications
examples: Add table with all training hyperparameters
Specify exact hardware configuration for experiments

contribution_clarity.feedback: Contributions are listed but could be more distinctive
contribution_clarity.improvement: Explicitly compare with prior work limitations
examples: Create comparison table with existing methods
Highlight unique aspects of the proposed approach

recommendations: Strengthen explicit connection to main thesis
